title: Layouts and Groups
excerpt: Layouts and Groups Nested layouts let the keep shared chrome mounted while page content changes underneath it. Minimal working example The directory groups routes without adding to the URL. Why it matters Layouts are the

title: Middleware
excerpt: Middleware Middleware runs before loaders, actions, page rendering, and API handlers. Use it for auth gates, request scoped locals, tenant resolution, tracing, and any logic that should happen before route code executes.

title: Navigation

title: Error Handling
excerpt: Error Handling The framework now follows a TanStack style split between caught errors and uncaught failures. Minimal working example The model throws a typed caught error. throws a typed 404 caught error. renders caught

title: SSR and Hydration
excerpt: SSR and Hydration renders full HTML documents on the server. Hydration then revives the same route tree in the browser. Minimal working example What is rendered into the document managed output route HTML under serialize

title: Streaming and Deferred Data
excerpt: Streaming and Deferred Data Streaming is no longer a future feature. HTML responses are streamed, and deferred loader keys can resolve after the first bytes leave the server. Minimal working example What streams the HTML

title: Head and Meta
excerpt: Head and Meta Each route can contribute document metadata. The framework renders it on the server and reconciles the managed head region during soft transitions. Minimal working example Why this matters Accessible client

title: CSS Modules
excerpt: CSS Modules The framework docs app uses CSS Modules as the default styling model because they keep ownership local and hydration safe. Minimal working example Bridging framework emitted markdown classes Markdown routes e

title: Global CSS
excerpt: Global CSS A Bun native SSR app gets fragile when global CSS becomes the dumping ground for route specific styles. Keep it small. Good global responsibilities design tokens in box sizing and element resets global body ty

title: Dev Server
excerpt: Dev Server is designed for correctness first. It rebuilds when the route signature changes and keeps client transitions working against fresh payloads. What the dev server owns file watching through Bun friendly dev orch

title: CLI
excerpt: CLI The CLI is intentionally small. Each command maps directly to a framework lifecycle step. Commands What they do scaffolds a new app in the current directory. starts the Bun dev server with generated snapshots and cli
